title: Gridora Infrastructure Platform JV for Strategic Project Delivery
description: IHC, alongside ADQ and Modon Holding, launched Gridora—a joint venture aimed at accelerating strategic infrastructure project delivery in the UAE and internationally. This platform aggregates capabilities, resources, and capital for large-scale infrastructure development, positioning itself as a key player for third-party contractors, technology suppliers, and engineering firms seeking access to Gulf and international markets.
example: An international engineering company specializing in renewable energy grids could partner with Gridora to deploy next-generation electrical infrastructure in the UAE. Technology vendors could supply smart city solutions for Gridora’s urbanization projects, while logistics providers could become exclusive partners for construction materials delivery.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify sectors (e.g., energy, transport, utilities) where joint project participation is most feasible.
Step 2: Engage Gridora executive management to present proposals for co-developing or subcontracting in new infrastructure projects.
Step 3: Align on technical standards and regulatory requirements specific to each project.
Step 4: Secure JV or subcontracting agreements detailing scope, investment share, and revenue model.
Step 5: Jointly execute and deliver strategic projects with reporting and evaluation milestones.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Dirham-Backed Stablecoin for Enhanced Cross-Border Payments
description: IHC, ADQ, and First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB) are pioneering the launch of a UAE Dirham-backed stablecoin. This initiative aims to improve digital payments, cross-border trade settlement, and blockchain financial innovation. Fintechs, payment processors, and e-commerce providers can integrate this stablecoin to offer instant, low-cost settlement and cross-currency remittances in the Gulf region.
example: A regional fintech startup could integrate the Dirham stablecoin to offer instant remittance services to expats in the UAE, cutting transaction times and costs. E-commerce marketplaces selling across the GCC could use the stablecoin for efficient settlement and reduced FX risk.
roadmap: Step 1: Conduct a technical assessment for integrating stablecoin into existing payment infrastructure.
Step 2: Liaise with IHC/ADQ/FAB to join pilot programs or sandbox environments.
Step 3: Complete regulatory compliance and obtain necessary licenses for digital assets.
Step 4: Launch beta offerings using the stablecoin, iterating based on user feedback.
Step 5: Scale the stablecoin application across additional services and geographies.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Strategic Real Estate Joint Ventures and Asset Co-Development
description: IHC and Modon are investing in high-profile real estate assets including a 50% JV for 2 Finsbury Avenue, London. This signals openness to collaborative development and co-investment in prime properties—ideal for real estate developers, construction firms, and facilities management companies looking for capital, access, or operational partnerships.
example: A European property developer could propose a partnership with IHC/Modon to jointly develop commercial or residential projects in London or the UAE, leveraging IHC’s capital and international reach while contributing local know-how.
roadmap: Step 1: Perform market analysis to identify synergistic development opportunities.
Step 2: Approach IHC or Modon JV teams with detailed business proposals.
Step 3: Undertake joint due diligence and feasibility assessment.
Step 4: Structure co-investment agreements with clear profit sharing.
Step 5: Start project development and execute ongoing asset management cooperatively.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Healthcare Market Entry and Expansion via Strategic Acquisitions
description: IHC subsidiary PureHealth acquired a 60% stake in Greece’s largest private healthcare provider, Hellenic Healthcare Group, for USD 2.3 billion. This demonstrates IHC's active search for international healthcare assets and expansion—presenting significant M&A, JV, and supply chain partnership opportunities for hospital systems, healthtech firms, and pharmaceutical suppliers.
example: A digital health company could approach PureHealth for collaborations in deploying AI-powered diagnostics across its hospital network in Greece and the UAE. Pharma suppliers could secure large-scale procurement agreements based on PureHealth’s expanded footprint.
roadmap: Step 1: Map PureHealth’s portfolio for possible market or technological synergies.
Step 2: Initiate M&A or partnership discussions targeting strategic fit (e.g., digital health, specialty clinics).
Step 3: Conduct joint commercial and regulatory analysis for the targeted geography.
Step 4: Secure board and regulatory approvals for investments or supply agreements.
Step 5: Launch collaborative pilot projects with defined outcome metrics.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Supply Chain Integration with Growing Agri-Food Portfolio
description: Al Ain Farms, under IHC, signed a Dh285 million agreement to acquire Al Jazira Poultry Farm, adding capacity and scale to its agri-food portfolio. This expansion opens doors for agritech providers, feed suppliers, logistics companies, and food retailers to integrate with IHC’s supply chain or to co-develop new consumer food products.
example: An agritech startup offering climate-controlled poultry solutions could enter a technology partnership with Al Ain Farms to improve efficiency and yields. Grocery retailers could negotiate supply deals for premium poultry products with guaranteed quality and volumes.
roadmap: Step 1: Assess the expanded Al Ain Farms/Arabian Farms operational needs.
Step 2: Propose tailored agritech solutions or supply agreements.
Step 3: Collaborate on pilot projects or test supply runs.
Step 4: Agree on long-term contracts with volume and technology milestones.
Step 5: Expand integration to other product lines or regions as trust builds.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Luxury Hospitality Co-Development and Asset Management
description: Alpha Dhabi Holding (IHC subsidiary) boosted its controlling stake in NCTH to 73.7%, consolidating premium hospitality assets. This creates immediate partnership prospects for high-end hospitality operators, interior designers, ESG consultants, and luxury travel services in co-branding, operations, and asset upgrade projects.
example: A global luxury hotel brand could enter a management or joint branding agreement for one of Alpha Dhabi’s hotels. ESG consultancies can pitch solutions to improve energy and water use across properties, aligning with IHC’s sustainability narrative.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify target properties or segments within Alpha Dhabi’s hospitality portfolio.
Step 2: Propose business models (management contracts, JV, or capex-light partnerships).
Step 3: Jointly define operating standards and sustainability benchmarks.
Step 4: Deploy brand and operational changes supported by marketing push.
Step 5: Measure uplift in occupancy and revenue; review partnership renewal/expansion.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Employee Benefits Partnerships via Ghaf Plan Enrollment
description: IHC signed an MoU with Lunate to explore enrolling employees in the Ghaf Benefits plan, highlighting an opportunity for providers of fintech, insurance, healthtech, and employee engagement platforms to offer products integrated into large-scale employer benefit ecosystems.
example: A digital health insurance provider could propose supplementary services to the Ghaf plan via IHC, increasing product stickiness and wellness outcomes. Employee engagement tech platforms can partner to digitize Ghaf plan processes for easier benefit access.
roadmap: Step 1: Research Ghaf plan structure and IHC employee demographic needs.
Step 2: Develop tailored add-on products or software integrations.
Step 3: Pitch partnership to IHC HR and Lunate decision-makers.
Step 4: Pilots and employee feedback loops for continuous improvement.
Step 5: Broader rollout across other portfolio companies as success is demonstrated.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Global Fashion Retail Expansion through Multiply Group & Tendam
description: Multiply Group (an IHC subsidiary) acquired a controlling stake in global apparel player Tendam, indicating readiness for further brand partnerships, supply chain integration, or digital commerce cooperation with manufacturers, retail technology providers, and distribution firms in the fashion sector.
example: A European fashion tech platform could partner with Multiply/Tendam to digitize inventory management and enhance omnichannel retail experiences. Apparel manufacturers could negotiate production contracts for Tendam’s expanded line-up.
roadmap: Step 1: Map Multiply/Tendam’s global retail network and unmet needs.
Step 2: Approach their management with partnership or technology pilot proposals.
Step 3: Negotiate distribution, supply, or technology integration agreements.
Step 4: Launch joint initiatives and monitor KPIs for scalability.
Step 5: Expand cooperation scope if initial projects succeed.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion
